metadata.title: USN-6555-1 -- X.Org X Server vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Jan-Niklas Sohn discovered that the X.Org X Server incorrectly handled XKB button actions. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause the X Server to crash, execute arbitrary code, or escalate privileges. (CVE-2023-6377)  Jan-Niklas Sohn discovered that the X.Org X Server incorrectly handled memory when processing the RRChangeOutputProperty and RRChangeProviderProperty APIs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause the X Server to crash, or obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2023-6478)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6555-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  xserver-xorg-core - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.5 xorg-server-source - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.5 xserver-xorg-dev - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.5 xvfb - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.5 xnest - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.5 xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.5 xserver-xephyr - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.5 xserver-common - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.5 No subscription required  xwayland - 2:22.1.1-1ubuntu0.9 No subscription required
